header.title: Outsourcing
header.subtitle: Requirements specification for project tasks to be outsourced
header.abstract: This document describes the exact requirements for each component and each task within the outsourced part of the project. It should preferably be tied to a tool for generating test cases to verify the conformance with the specifications of each component, but as the tool is not yet in place, it will for the time being be free form. For the same reason, the content is rather rudimentary.

document.body:
Source files
The data provided by the Divvun project is a computational linguistic model built using Xerox finite state tools, and thus the source files are in the formats supported by Xerox. More specifically, the source files are of the following types, extensively described in Beesley & Karttunen 2003:
twolc
morphophonological descriptions, accounting for phenomenas such as consonant gradation, vowel shortening, monophtongization, etc.
lexc
covers both morphological processes such as compounding, derivation and inflection, as well as the complete lexicon
The cooperating companies are expected to be able to take these formats directly as their input, or make scripts that will convert from the Xerox formats to the companies internal formats without loss or change of linguistic coverage.
